text: "La La La (If I Had You)" is a song by Bobby Sherman released in November 1969.Murrells, Joseph. (1978). The Book of Golden Discs, Barrie & Jenkins, p. 394. The song spent 11 weeks on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, peaking at No. 9,Bobby Sherman - Chart History - The Hot 100, Billboard.com. Accessed July 13, 2016. while reaching No. 14 on Billboards Easy Listening chart.Bobby Sherman - Chart History - Adult Contemporary, Billboard.com. Accessed July 13, 2016."Billboard Top 40 Easy Listening", Billboard, December 20, 1969. p. 62. Accessed July 13, 2016. In Canada, the song reached No. 7 on the "RPM 100","RPM 100", RPM, Volume 12, No. 23, Jan 24, 1970. Accessed July 13, 2016. No. 15 on RPMs adult contemporary chart,"Adult", RPM, Volume 12, No. 24, January 31, 1970. Accessed July 13, 2016. and No. 16 on Toronto's CHUM 30 chart. Chart No. 674, December 27, 1969. CHUM. The song earned Sherman a gold record.Leszczak, Bob. (2015). From Small Screen to Vinyl: A Guide to Television Stars Who Made Records, 1950-2000, Rowman & Littlefield. p. 288.
